title: Raymond V. Darby
text:
Raymond V. Darby (December 11, 1896 – March 5, 1953) was an American politician that served on the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20County%20Board%20of%20Supervisors">Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors</a> from 1944 until his death. He was the Mayor of <a href="Inglewood%2C%20California">Inglewood, California</a> for fourteen years.
Biography.
Raymond Vern Darby was born in <a href="Washington%2C%20Kansas">Washington, Kansas</a> on December 11, 1896. In 1944, he was elected to the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20County%20Board%20of%20Supervisors">Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors</a> and re-elected in 1946, 1948, 1950 and again in 1952. On March 5, 1953, he was struck in the Board of Supervisors hearing room by an irate property owner and died later that day from a <a href="brain%20hemorrhage">brain hemorrhage</a>.
Prior to serving on the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20County%20Board%20of%20Supervisors">Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors</a>.
